tit.cmt: 京都府 を追加しました。

sen.j: 船岡駅（ふなおかえき）は、京都府南丹市園部町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Funaoka Station is a railway station on the San-in Main Line of West Japan Passenger Railways (JR West Japan) located in Sonobe town, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Funaoka Station, located in Sonobe town, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station on the San-in Main Line of West Japan Passenger Railways (JR West Japan).
Funaoka Station, located in Sonobe-cho, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station on the Sanin Main Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。会社名を修正しました。

sen.j: 山陰本線はこの駅から福知山方面、居組駅までの各駅は西日本旅客鉄道福知山支社が管轄する（但し、支社直轄となるのは和田山駅まで）。
sen.e: Each station on the San-in Main Line heading towards Fukuchiyama from this station until Igumi Station fall under the control of West Japan Passenger Railways Fukuchiyama branch (because formerly Wadayama Station directly controlled the branch).

Each station on the San-in Main Line heading toward Fukuchiyama from this station until Igumi Station falls under the control of West Japan Passenger Railways' Fukuchiyama branch (because formerly Wadayama Station directly controlled the branch).

Each station on the Sanin Main Line heading toward Fukuchiyama from this station until Igumi Station falls under the control of West Japan Railway Company's Fukuchiyama branch (however, only stations up to Wadayama Station are under direct control of the branch).
sen.cmt: Sanin としました。West Japan Railway Company としました。括弧内の翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 隣の園部駅からは西日本旅客鉄道京都支社の管轄であり、両支社の指令上の境界は園部駅となる。
sen.e: The adjacent Sonobe Station controls the West Japan Passenger Railway Kyoto branch with the boundary for both branches being Sonobe Station.
The adjacent Sonobe Station controls the Kyoto branch of the West Japan Passenger Railway, with the boundary for both branches being Sonobe Station.
The stations from the adjacent Sonobe Station are under the control of the Kyoto branch of the West Japan Railway Company, with the boundary for both branches being Sonobe Station.
sen.cmt: West Japan Railway Company としました。

sen.j: また、この駅から福知山方面ではICOCA・Jスルー等の利用もできない。
sen.e: Also, ICOCA/"J-Through" passes can not be used from this station onwards headed towards Fukuchiyama.
Also, ICOCA/J-THRU passes can't be used from this station onward toward Fukuchiyama.
Also, ICOCA/J-Through cards can't be used from this station onward toward Fukuchiyama.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station Structures
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 線路が通る堤の上に島式1面2線のプラットホームを持つ、行違い可能な地上駅である。
sen.e: The station is above-ground, tracks are located on embankments and the there is a single island-like platform with 2 sides which can handle traffic in different directions.
The station is above ground, the tracks are located on embankments, and the there is a single island-like two-sided platform that can handle traffic in both directions.
The station is above ground, the tracks are located on embankments, and there is an island platform with two tracks that can handle traffic in both directions.
sen.cmt: island platform with two tracksとしました。

sen.j: 無人駅で駅舎はなく、直接ホームに入る形になっている。
sen.e: The station is unmanned and there is no station building with passengers proceeding directly to the platform.
The unmanned station has no station building, so passengers proceed directly to the platform.
The unmanned station has no station building, so passengers proceed directly to the platform.

sen.j: 自動券売機は設置されていない。
sen.e: Automatic ticket vending machine are not in place.
Automatic ticket vending machine aren't provided.
Automatic ticket vending machine aren't provided.

sen.j: また、これより先の電化区間の駅では、普通列車しか停車しない駅を中心に4両分しかホームの嵩上げが行われていない。
sen.e: Also, stations from here on down the electrified section of line are mainly for local (stopping-all-stations) trains and, the raised platforms can only handle 4 carriages.
Moreover, stations from here on down the electrified section of the line are mainly for local trains (stopping at all stations), and the raised platforms can only handle four carriages.
Moreover, stations from here on down the electrified section of the line are mainly for local trains (stopping at all stations), and the raised platforms can only handle four cars.

sen.j: ※通常は上下線とも2番のりばを使用する。
sen.e: * Normally both inbound ad outbound trains use platform 2.
* Normally, inbound and outbound trains use platform 2.
* Normally, inbound and outbound trains use Platform 2.
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 1番のりばは行違い待ちを行う場合のみ使用される。
sen.e: Platform 1 is only used at times when trains are waiting for another train headed in a different direction.
Platform 1 is only used when a train is waiting for another train headed in the opposite direction.
Platform 1 is only used when a train is waiting for another train headed in the opposite direction.

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station Vicinity
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 京都府道25号亀岡園部線
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Highway #25: Kameoka Sonobe Route
Kyoto Prefectural Highway 25: Kameoka Sonobe Route
Kyoto Prefectural Route 25: Kameoka-Sonobe Line
sen.cmt: 道路表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 船岡簡易郵便局
sen.e: Funaoka Kani Post Office
The Funaoka Kani post office
The Funaoka Kani post office

sen.j: 南丹市立川辺小学校
sen.e: Kawabe Nantan City Municipal Elementary School
Kawabe Nantan City Municipal Elementary School
Nantan Municipal Kawabe Elementary School
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Usage
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約60人である。
sen.e: In FY 2006 there were approximately 60 passengers per day.
Approximately 60 passengers per day in fiscal year 2006.
The number of daily passengers was about 60 in fiscal year 2006.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture statistics)
(Source: Statistics from Kyoto Prefecture)
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1953年（昭和28年）10月10日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: October 10, 1953 - Opened as a station of Japan National Railways.
October 10, 1953: It opened as a station of Japan National Railways.
October 10, 1953: It opened as a station of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 旅客営業のみ。
sen.e: Just to service passenger traffic.
Services were for passenger traffic only.
Services were for passenger traffic only.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 – With the split-up and privatization of the national railways, becomes a JR West Japan station.
April 1, 1987: It became a facility of JR West Japan with the split-up and privatization of the national railway system.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West facility as a result of the split and privatization of the Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.e: Adjacent Stations
Adjacent Stations

West Japan Passenger Railways (JR West Japan)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)

sen.e: San-in Main Line
